blog.name: mysecretlifeofdaydreams
blog.title: the secret life of daydreams
blog.description:
Bruna, 24, Rio.
personal blog with a taste for fandom

body:
things that happened at CCXP:

- I met Ricky Whittle twice kind of by accident over 24 hours. He high fived me the first time and let me take a picture the second time. Also he laughed when I said “Thank you, Shadow Moon” and it was so ???? CUTE!!! Also, he’s a nice hugger guysssss.

- I saw Sebastian Stan up close, ALSO by accident, and he touched my hand and I was ovulating and… can I get pregnant from this????? He’s flawless. 👏👏👏 Bucky Barnes touched my left hand, do I get soviet bonus points?

- We also saw Tom Welling and he’s like hot daddy goals 👍 And I mean this literally and not in a weird sexual way bc apparently he’s got a kid on the way.

- My friends and I left Batman Alley less than an hour before Brie Larson and Jessica Chastain got there. Why is life like this? 😭😭

So many things happened and it was awesome 😍

blog.name: thefeministherald
blog.title: The Feminist Herald
blog.description: Brief Feminist Updates.  Feminism: Supporting the fight against the oppression of women through activism and the interrogation of the tools used to create and perpetuate a social system that oppresses women in order to afford privilege to men, especially white men. Tools like misogynistic narratives, ideas and attitudes and their use in politics, the media, education and all other social institutions and constructs. In addition, examining and pointing out how racism, homophobia and other oppressive systems and forms of discrimination intersect with misogynistic ideas creating hybrid attitudes, narratives and ideas against women of color, LGBT women, women with disabilities and other women who face those forms of discrimination.

summary: ‘Captain Marvel’: Brie Larson Flies Into Brazil’s Comic Con Experience With New Footage
body:
‘Captain Marvel’: Brie Larson Flies Into Brazil’s Comic Con Experience With New Footage

Fresh off the ’90s superHERo awesomeness of the new Captain Marvel trailer, Brie Larson flew into (not literally, obviously) Brazil’s Comic Con Experience (CCXP) in Sao Paulo to talk about the forthcoming Marvel Studios film.

Larson participated in a panel and also shared footage and an extended trailer from the comic book flick with the packed audience. But if you’re looking for that footage, you probably not going to find it because it was exclusive to CCXP.

However, the Academy Award-winning actress tweeted a video of the crowd which was massive. “Look at these gorgeous humans feeling all the feels with me after watching exclusive footage from #CaptainMarvel,” she wrote.
